title: quarrisk: Quarantine risk explorer (Delta)
text: COVID-19 pandemic, governments around world relied border quarantine systems prevent imported infections seeding community outbreaks. However, new variants like Delta emerged, understanding often systems “leak” became critical. Even small probabilities breach trigger large community transmission. quarrisk package developed make risk easier explore communicate. transforms complex epidemiological simulation accessible tool users can: View simulated data behind quarantine breach events. Compare key infection-risk measures across scenarios. Interact intuitive dashboard built using Shiny. vignette introduces package step--step beginning background data, exploring simple summaries ending interactive dashboard brings results life.

title: quarrisk: Quarantine risk explorer (Delta)
text: data included quarrisk come stochastic simulations infected travellers quarantine workers. observation represents one simulated individual timing information (infectious, detected, isolated, etc.). Load dataset packaged library: Key variables: days_infectious_community – number days individual infectious community integrated_FoI – total “integrated” infectiousness period FoI_max – highest instantaneous infectiousness value scenario – quarantine setting simulated (traveller vs. worker, vaccinated vs. unvaccinated, home vs. hotel) Together, variables capture much potential exposure case contributed community..
code: library(quarrisk) data(breach_data, package = "quarrisk")  utils::head(breach_data[, c("days_infectious_community","FoI_max","integrated_FoI","scenario")]) #>   days_infectious_community     FoI_max integrated_FoI #> 1                  8.143508 0.145699666     0.54867389 #> 2                 12.365827 0.300247326     1.50842976 #> 3                 20.994417 0.087240686     0.71328332 #> 4                 10.070068 0.006514228     0.02681432 #> 5                 12.545853 0.116555915     0.59551965 #> 6                 13.181670 0.051949719     0.29837885 #>                           scenario #> 1 Traveller: Unvaccinated, Home 7d #> 2 Traveller: Unvaccinated, Home 7d #> 3 Traveller: Unvaccinated, Home 7d #> 4 Traveller: Unvaccinated, Home 7d #> 5 Traveller: Unvaccinated, Home 7d #> 6 Traveller: Unvaccinated, Home 7d

title: quarrisk: Quarantine risk explorer (Delta)
text: see risk evolves time, can average force--infection (FoI) measures day scenario. summarisation condenses thousands simulated individuals simple daily trend can compared across quarantine types.
code: daily_summary <- breach_data |> dplyr::filter(!is.na(.data$integrated_FoI)) |> dplyr::mutate(day = floor(.data$days_infectious_community)) |> dplyr::group_by(.data$scenario, .data$day) |> dplyr::summarise( mean_integrated_FoI = mean(.data$integrated_FoI, na.rm = TRUE), mean_FoI_max        = mean(.data$FoI_max,        na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop" )  utils::head(daily_summary) #> # A tibble: 6 × 4 #>   scenario                    day mean_integrated_FoI mean_FoI_max #>   <chr>                     <dbl>               <dbl>        <dbl> #> 1 Traveller: AZ1, Hotel 14d     0             0.00216       0.411  #> 2 Traveller: AZ1, Hotel 14d     1             0.0107        0.239  #> 3 Traveller: AZ1, Hotel 14d     2             0.0415        0.382  #> 4 Traveller: AZ1, Hotel 14d     3             0.173         0.492  #> 5 Traveller: AZ1, Hotel 14d     4             0.0293        0.0717 #> 6 Traveller: AZ1, Hotel 14d     5             0.404         0.404

title: quarrisk: Quarantine risk explorer (Delta)
text: plot shows average infectiousness community changes time scenario. Higher lines indicate scenarios , average, individuals infectious longer higher intensity implying greater potential community outbreak.  Interpreting figure: Scenarios longer higher curves show higher likelihood infectious people active community. Home quarantine unvaccinated travellers tends show largest average FoI meaning scenario carries highest breach risk. Fully vaccinated travellers hotel quarantine settings generally result shorter, lower curves, reflecting reduced exposure risk. comparisons demonstrate quarantine design vaccination coverage jointly shape probability breach.
code: ggplot2::ggplot(   daily_summary,   ggplot2::aes(     x = .data$day,     y = .data$mean_integrated_FoI,     colour = .data$scenario   ) ) +   ggplot2::geom_line(linewidth = 1.2) +   ggplot2::labs(     title = "Average integrated FoI Across Quarantine Scenarios",     subtitle = "Comparison of average community infectiousness across Delta quarantine models",     x = "Days infectious in community",     y = "Average integrated FoI",     colour = "Scenario"   ) +   ggplot2::theme_minimal(base_size = 14) +   ggplot2::theme(     plot.title = ggplot2::element_text(face = "bold"),     plot.subtitle = ggplot2::element_text(size = 11, margin = ggplot2::margin(b = 10)),     legend.position = "bottom",     panel.grid.minor = ggplot2::element_blank()   )

title: quarrisk: Quarantine risk explorer (Delta)
text: static plots give quick overview, policymakers often want interact data toggle measures, focus one scenario, view . quarrisk package provides embedded Shiny app purpose. app opens browser allows : Switch Integrated Maximum FoI, Choose individual multiple scenarios View daily trends side--side clean, colour-coded interface. , users can quickly identify quarantine designs produce safest outcomes.

title: quarrisk: Quarantine risk explorer (Delta)
text: quarrisk package turns complex outbreak simulations clear, interactive visual stories. blending pre-cleaned data, reproducible R code, simple Shiny interface, enables technical non-technical audiences understand: quarantine breach risk arises, scenarios safer others, policies effectively reduce transmission. short, quarrisk bridges data analysis real-world decision-making showing modelling can directly inform public-health planning.

title: Quarantine risk explorer (Delta)
text: quarrisk R package helps understand visualise risk quarantine breaches different COVID-19 quarantine vaccination scenarios. turns simulation outputs clear summaries includes simple interactive Shiny dashboard.

title: Quarantine risk explorer (Delta)
text: Provides built-dataset (breach_data) summarises simulated infection outcomes travellers workers. Lets users compare breach risk across scenarios (e.g., vaccinated vs unvaccinated, home vs hotel). Includes Shiny app shows interactive time-series plots. Documents every function dataset roxygen2 help pages vignette.

title: Quarantine risk explorer (Delta)

what: Make a small summary and plot
title: Quarantine risk explorer (Delta)
code: set.seed(1) small <- dplyr::slice_sample(breach_data, n = min(5000, nrow(breach_data)))  daily <- small |>   dplyr::filter(!is.na(.data$integrated_FoI)) |>   dplyr::mutate(day = floor(.data$days_infectious_community)) |>   dplyr::summarise(     mean_integrated_FoI = mean(.data$integrated_FoI, na.rm = TRUE),     .by = c(scenario, day)   )  ggplot2::ggplot(daily, ggplot2::aes(day, mean_integrated_FoI, colour = scenario)) +   ggplot2::geom_line(linewidth = 1) +   ggplot2::labs(     title = "Average Integrated Force of Infection by Scenario",     x = "Days infectious in community",     y = "Average integrated FoI",     colour = "Scenario"   ) +   ggplot2::theme_minimal()

title: Simulated quarantine breach time-series — breach_data
text: dataset simulated quarantine scenarios, combining results travellers workers.

title: Simulated quarantine breach time-series — breach_data
text: data frame ~31,000 rows 20 variables: days_infectious_community Days infectious community. integrated_FoI Total infectiousness (integrated force infection). FoI_max Maximum instantaneous infectiousness. scenario Scenario label (traveller/worker, vaccine type, quarantine length). FoI Instantaneous force infection. compliant Logical; whether quarantine/isolation rules followed. days_in_extended_quar Days spent extended quarantine. days_in_isolation Days isolation. days_in_quar Days initial quarantine. days_to_detection Days detection/diagnosis. expressed_symptoms Logical; whether symptoms expressed. index_case Logical; whether row index case. symptomatic Logical; whether case became symptomatic. t_incubation Incubation period (days). t_latent Latent period (days). t_post_incubation Post-incubation infectious period (days). tested_positive Logical; whether test returned positive. time_discharged Time discharge quarantine/isolation. time_removed Time removed infectious pool (recovery/isolation). vaccinated Logical; vaccination status.

title: Simulated quarantine breach time-series — breach_data
text: Adapted Mike Lydeamore et al. (2021), Science Advances.
